title: Vahid Amiri
text:
Vahid Amiri (, born 2 April 1988) is an Iranian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player playing for <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> in the <a href="Persian%20Gulf%20Pro%20League">Persian Gulf Pro League</a>. Amiri represented the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national football team</a> at the <a href="2015%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2015</a> and <a href="2019%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2019 AFC Asian Cup</a>s and also <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>. He predominantly plays as a left winger but can play as a second striker.
Club career.
Amiri started his career with <a href="Datis%20Lorestan%20F.C.">Datis Lorestan</a>. He left <a href="Gahar%20Zagros%20F.C.">Gahar Zagros</a> in the summer of 2011 and <a href="Naft%20Masjed%20Soleyman%20F.C.">Naft Masjed Soleyman</a> and spent two seasons with them.
Naft Tehran.
In May 2013 he joined <a href="Naft%20Tehran">Naft Tehran</a> with a two-year contract. Amiri scored his first goal for Naft on 6 August 2013 in a 1–1 draw against <a href="Damash%20Gilan">Damash Gilan</a>. He scored his first <a href="Asian%20Champions%20League">Asian Champions League</a> on 7 April 2015 in a 3–0 away win against Saudi club <a href="Al-Shabab%20FC%20%28Riyadh%29">Al-Shabab</a>. Amiri scored on 16 September 2015 in a 2–1 loss to <a href="Al-Ahli%20Dubai%20F.C.">Al-Ahli Dubai</a> in the quarter–finals of the Asian Champions League.
Persepolis.
Amiri joined <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> in summer of 2016 with a two years contract. He won two league with Persepolis and was named <a href="Iran%20football%20award%20winners">Iranian Footballer of the Year</a> in 2018. He played 74 games and scored 9 goals for his team.
Trabzonspor.
On 21 July 2018, Amiri agreed to a two-year contract with Turkish Giants <a href="Trabzonspor">Trabzonspor</a>.
Persepolis.
On 13 July 2019, Amiri signed a two-year contract with <a href="Persian%20Gulf%20Pro%20League">Persian Gulf Pro League</a> champions Persepolis. After returning to Persepolis, He said:I am very happy to return to Persepolis once again. I had several offers from the other Iranian teams but I opted to return to my home.Also clubs No. 19 was given to Amiri.
International career.
He was called into <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran</a>'s <a href="2015%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2015 AFC Asian Cup</a> squad on 30 December 2014 by <a href="Carlos%20Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a>. He made his debut on a friendly against <a href="Iraq%20national%20football%20team">Iraq</a> on 4 January 2015. He missed a decisive penalty against <a href="Iraq%20national%20football%20team">Iraq</a> which lead to elimination of <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran</a> from <a href="Asian%20Cup%202015">Asian Cup 2015</a>. Amiri scored his first international goal in a 2–0 victory against <a href="Chile%20national%20football%20team">Chile</a>.
In May 2018 he was named in Iran's preliminary <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">squad</a> for the <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a> in Russia.
Personal life.
Amiri was born in the small village of <a href="Darreh-ye%20Badam">Darreh-ye Badam</a> in <a href="Lorestan%20Province">Lorestan Province</a>. He has a degree in law and as of January 2016 is studying for his master's degree in Physical Education.
